name: Buttermilk Gravy
author: lutzflcat
summary: This gravy is a diner classic, often served over biscuits and sausage. But it's equally good on fried chicken, pork chops, mashed potatoes, country fried steak, and french fries for a hearty meal any time of day.
ingredients: 1 ⅔ cups buttermilk, or more as needed
directions: Heat bacon drippings in a skillet over medium heat
Add flour and whisk until well combined and bubbly, about 1 minute
Pour in buttermilk gradually and bring to a boil, about 3 minutes
Reduce heat and simmer, whisking constantly, until thickened and smooth, 2 to 3 minutes
Stir in chicken bouillon, salt, and pepper
If gravy is too thick, whisk in more buttermilk until you reach your desired consistency
